metadata.name: Process Memory Dump Via Comsvcs.DLL
metadata.comment: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\rundll32.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('rundll32.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rundll32')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('comsvcs')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('full')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('#-')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('#+')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('#24')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('24 ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('minidump'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('24')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('comsvcs')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('full')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' #')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(',#')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(', #')))))

output.summary: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)
